title: Code Transformation Format (CodeTF)
description: A format for representing the results of code transformations

run.description: Metadata about the run that produced the results

results.description: The results of the code transformations that were applied during analysis

vendor.description: Name of the organization that produced the tool

tool.description: Name of the tool that produced the CodeTF results

version.description: Version of the tool that produced the CodeTF results

projectName.description: Name of the project that was analyzed

commandLine.description: The command line used to re-create this run

elapsed.description: How long, in miliseconds, the analysis took to execute

directory.description: The location on disk of the code directory being scanned

codemod.description: ID of the transformation that was applied

summary.description: A short phrase describing the changes made

description.description: A longer description of the changes made

detectionTool.description: Metadata about the tool that detected the issue

failure.description: If present indicates that the codemod failed to run

reason.description: A short description of why the codemod failed

exception.description: More detailed information about the exception that caused the failure

failedFiles.description: A set of file paths for files that the tool failed to parse or transform

changeset.description: The changes for a given codemod

unfixed.description: A set of file paths for files that the tool failed to fix

artifact.description: The file containing the SARIF or other input

path.description: The path of the file (relative to the directory) that was changed

diff.description: The unified diff format of the changes made to the file

ai.description: Metadata about AI tool used to generate the fix

strategy.description: The strategy used to generate the fix

provisional.description: Indicates that the fix is provisional

fixedFindings.description: List of findings that were fixed by this changeset. Used for findings that can't be attached to a specific change.

fixQuality.description: Metadata about the quality of the fix

safetyRating.description: Can this change be accepted without breaking the code?

effectivenessRating.description: Does it fix the problem without introducing syntactic or semantic issues?

cleanlinessRating.description: Does the code make unnecessary costmetic changes (e.g. add/remove whitespace, comments)?

lineNumber.description: The line number that was changed

description.description: A human-readable description of the change

diffSide.description: The side of the diff that the change is on. 'right' indicates that the lineNumber and description correspond to a position in the new or modified code. 'left' indicates these fields correspond to a position in the original code. Descriptions of the change itself should generally use 'right', except in cases where the only change is a deletion. In contrast, 'left' can be used to describe the original problem being fixed.

packageActions.description: The package actions that were needed to support changes to the file

fixedFindings.description: List of findings that were fixed at this location

package.description: The package that was added or removed

provider.description: Name of the AI provider used to generate this fix

model.description: Name of the model used to generate this fix

tokens.description: Total number of tokens used to generate the fix

name.description: Name of the tool that detected the issue

id.description: A unique identifier for the finding, if provided by the detection tool. Concerning logically equivalent findings across scans, this identifier has the same semantics as `guid` from SARIF.

rule.description: The rule that detected the issue

id.description: A unique identifier for the finding, if provided by the detection tool. Concerning logically equivalent findings across scans, this identifier has the same semantics as `guid` from SARIF.

rule.description: The rule that detected the issue

path.description: The path of the file (relative to the directory) that was not fixed

lineNumber.description: The line number that was not fixed

reason.description: A human-readable description of the reason the file was not fixed

name.description: The name of the rule. Potentially the same as the ID, but more human-readable

score.description: A score from 0 to 100 representing the quality of the fix

description.description: A human-readable description of the quality of the fix
